\section*{Country XX1 and YY1"}
```{r read-in data}
covid <- read.csv(file = here::here("Data/worldwidecases.csv")) 
```

```{r sgp-usa}
sgp_usa <- covid %>%
  mutate(date = dmy(dateRep), 
         yday = yday(date)) %>%
  rename(country = countriesAndTerritories) %>%
  filter(countryterritoryCode %in% c("SGP", "USA"),
         month %in% c(3:5)
         )
```

```{r cases-per-mil}
sgp_usa <- sgp_usa %>%
  group_by(country, yday) %>%
  mutate(cases_per_mil = (cases * (1000000 / popData2018)),
         deaths_per_mil = (deaths * (1000000 / popData2018))
         )
```

```{r bel-usa-barchart, fig.width = 7, fig.heigh = 5}
sgp_usa %>%
  ggplot() +
  geom_histogram(
    stat = "identity",
    width = 0.5,
    position = "dodge",
    aes(x = date, y = cases_per_mil, fill = country)
  ) +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom") 
```

```{r}
sgp_usa_week <- sgp_usa %>%
  mutate(week = week(date) - 8) # Set March 1 as Week 1 
```


```{r}
sgp_usa_week %>%
  mutate(death_prop = deaths_per_mil/cases_per_mil*100) %>%
  select(week, country, cases_per_mil, deaths_per_mil, death_prop) %>%
  group_by(week, country) %>%
  summarise(avg_cases = sum(cases_per_mil),
            avg_deaths = sum(deaths_per_mil),
            death_prop = mean(death_prop))
```
